Package hecc_up.gameParts

Class Metadata

java.lang.Object
hecc_up.gameParts.Metadata
All Implemented Interfaces:
FolderOutputterMetadataInterface, MetadataReadingInterface, SharedMetadata, Heccable, Parseable
public class Metadata extends Object implements FolderOutputterMetadataInterface, MetadataReadingInterface
This object basically represents the metadata for the HECCIN' Game

  • Field Details

    • rawMetadata

      private final String rawMetadata
      string with the raw metadata

    • title

      private String title
      what the game title is. defaults to "An Interactive Fiction"

    • isTitleDeclared

      private boolean isTitleDeclared
      whether or not the game title was declared. false by default

    • author

      private String author
      author name. "Anonymous" by default

    • isAuthorDeclared

      private boolean isAuthorDeclared
      whether or not the author was declared. false by default

    • startPassage

      private String startPassage
      The starting passage. defaults to "Start" if undefined

    • isIfidDeclared

      private boolean isIfidDeclared
      Whether or not the IFID was declared. False by default

    • ifid

      private String ifid
      The IFID. empty by default

    • variables

      private final List<Variable> variables
      All the variable definitions. STILL UNUSED!

  • Method Details

    • parseMetadata

      public void parseMetadata()
      Wrapper data for the metadata parsing stuff Does nothing if there's no metadata to parse

    • metadataRegexHandler

      private String metadataRegexHandler​(String regex, String input) throws NoMatchException
      A method which does the metadata regex matching things
      Parameters:
      regex - the regular expression being looked for in the input
      input - the string that the regex is being applied to
      Returns:
      the string that was found by the regex from the input
      Throws:
      NoMatchException - if no match was found

    • findVariables

      List<Variable> findVariables()
      Attempts to find the variable declarations within the metadata stuff, adding each of them to the variables arrayList

      Variables must be in the form:

      !var:
      variableName
      1 or more word characters (alphanumeric+underscore)
      = defaultValue
      defaultValue must be 1 or more non-whitespace characters (optional)
      // comment
      comment is anything between the // and the end of line (optional)
      Returns:
      the list of variables

    • getVariables

      public List<Variable> getVariables()
      returns the variables
      Returns:
      the variables

    • doesStartPassageExist

      public boolean doesStartPassageExist​(Set<String> passageNames)
      Used to check whether or not the start passage exists
      Parameters:
      passageNames - set of all defined passage names
      Returns:
      true if that set contains startPassage, false otherwise
